thread.title: Mets beat Cubs in National League championship opener
thread.title_full: Mets beat Cubs in National League championship opener | Reuters

author: Reuters
title: Mets beat Cubs in National League championship opener
text:
NEW YORK New York Mets starter Matt Harvey retired the first 12 batters on the way to a masterful 4-2 victory over the Chicago Cubs in the opener of the National League Championship Series on Saturday.
Harvey shut down the power-hitting Cubs on four hits over 7-2/3 innings with nine strikeouts and was followed to the mound by closer Jeurys Familia, who registered the last four outs for the save.
Red-hot Daniel Murphy continued his postseason barrage by putting New York ahead in the first by crushing a solo home run to right and Travis d'Arnaud belted one in the sixth off Cubs loser Jon Lester that bounced off the Big Apple in dead center.
Game Two of the best-of-seven to determine the National League representative in the World Series will be played on Sunday in New York, with the Cubs starting Jake Arrieta against fireballing Noah Syndergaard.
(Reporting by Larry Fine.; Editing by Andrew Both)
